Companies with Entry Level Jobs and Internships in Apparel Most of these positions require a college degree. While you don’t technically need a degree to become a fashion designer, you do need a portfolio. You can also work with a company that designs or sells clothing. Depending on whether you choose to work with a clothing company with a physical presence or an online company, you could work in finance, human resources, software development, customer support, or marketing. Marketing or advertising Clothing sales Fashion design Apparel deals with every stage of the clothing creation process: design, creation, and selling. Depending on your interests within apparel, you could work in any of the following areas: Photo Credit: Flickr user miss.libertine
